article_title: Bank of Thailand Cites First-Quarter Slowdown for Lower 2014 Growth Forecast
article_text:
BANGKOK—Thailand's central bank blamed a larger-than-expected slowdown in the first quarter for its trimmed growth forecast for the year, adding that a sluggish recovery in exports offers little hope.

In its quarterly report on Friday, the bank estimated the 2014 gross domestic product growth rate to be 1.5%, down from the 2.7% projection it made in March, because of stagnant growth earlier in the year. This compares with a growth...
